alert.note: Alert for Highland; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN PIKE, NORTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1041 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Leesburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Greenfield, Leesburg, Marshall, Bainbridge, Rocky Fork Point, Cynthiana, Highland Holiday, Highland, South Salem, Rocky Fork Lake, East Monroe, Samantha, Rainsboro, Paint Creek State Park and Highland County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
